required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Comparing Site-selection Strategies for Improving Speech Recognition Outcomes

brief_summary.textblock: Several studies in the past have tried to deactivate electrodes that are less optimal to improve speech recognition outcomes. The study aims to compare the measures based on which the deactivation was performed. The investigators aim to first examine if the measures are strongly correlated each other, and then compare the deactivation effects across measures. These measures are mainly behavioral including electrode discrimination, amplitude modulation detection thresholds, low-rate and focused detection thresholds and electrode-modiolus distance. The endpoint of the study is speech recognition performance post deactivation.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 12 months post award notice and will take up to 3.5 years to complete
primary_outcome.description: Electrodes will be evaluated based on (1) pitch discrimination (2) focused thresholds (3) amplitude modulation detection thresholds and (4) distances from the modious. Electrodes will be deactivated based on each of these measures and speech recognition will be evaluated to assess the effect of deactivation. The benefit of deactivation (speech recognition after deactivation minus before deactivation) will be derived for each measure. The measure that produces the greatest benefit will be identified.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Cochlear implant users with Nucleus and AB devices
arm_group.description: Speech recognition will be evaluated after poor electrodes are turned off.

intervention.description: Turning off electrodes on the electrode array based on imaging and psychophysical measures
intervention.arm_group_label: Cochlear implant users with Nucleus and AB devices

study_pop.textblock: Children and adults with cochlear implants

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Native speakers of English
- Cochlear Nucleus cochlear implant users or Advanced Bionics users
- Postlingually deafened
- Has had device experience for at least one year
- Can be child or adult at the time of enrollment
Exclusion Criteria:
- None

facility.name: Department of Communication Sciences and Disorders, ECU
